bill_title: revise the conditions for determining when an eminent domain judgement greatly exceeds the plaintiff's offer.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the conditions for determining when an eminent domain judgement greatly exceeds the plaintiff's offer. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 21-35-23 be amended to read as follows: 21-35-23. If the amount of compensation awarded to the defendant by final judgment in proceedings pursuant to this chapter is twenty thirty percent greater than the plaintiff's final initial offer which shall be filed with the court having jurisdiction over the action at the time trial is commenced, and if that and the total award exceeds seven hundred dollars, the court shall , in addition to such taxable costs as are allowed by law, allow reasonable attorney fees and compensation for not more than two expert witnesses, all as determined by the court. The fees and compensation are in addition to any taxable costs allowed by law. The plaintiff's initial offer shall be filed with the court having jurisdiction over the action at the time the trial is commenced. 300 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.029 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
